title: How an Accountability Partner Can Change Everything
summary: We care deeply about what others think of us, and this can be harnessed for good. An accountability partner or habit contract can create immediate consequences for breaking a habit. Knowing someone is watching can be a powerful motivator to stick with your commitments.
keyIdeas: We care deeply about what others think of us.
An accountability partner creates immediate social consequences.
Habit contracts make the costs of breaking a habit immediate and painful.
Knowing someone is watching increases your commitment.
Public commitments are more likely to be kept than private ones.
Social accountability can be more powerful than personal motivation.
The pain of letting others down can outweigh the pain of doing the work.
examples: Tell a friend you'll pay them $50 if you miss a workout.
Join a group where members check in daily about their habits.
Post your progress publicly to create social accountability.
Find an accountability partner who shares similar goals.
exercises: Identify one person who could be your accountability partner.
Create a simple habit contract with consequences for breaking it.
Make one habit commitment public to increase accountability.
reflections: What habit would benefit from social accountability?
Who in your life could help you stay accountable to your goals?
